frameDefinitions: A Supplier gives a Theme to a Recipient to fulfill a need or purpose (Imposed_purpose) of the Recipient.
This  frame contains words that talk about how Speakers name Entities.
A Donor transfers a Theme from a Donor to a Recipient.
A Deliverer hands off a Theme to a Recipient or (more indirectly) a Goal location, which is accessible to the Recipient.
A Theme has access to a Useful_location or is blocked from it by a Barrier. '' 'Making services accessible to those with special needs is expensive.'
An Offerer indicates that he or she is able and willing to give a Theme to a Potential_recipient.
frameExamples: Habituating the ground nesting chimp groups is done by <t>provisioning</t> them with sugar cane. CNI INI
They drove through an area <t>nicknamed</t> Sniper's Alley
The staff of Ebags <t>delivered</t> the umbrella well ahead of schedule.
Making services <t>accessible</t> to those with special needs is expensive.
The host graciously <t>offered</t> us food and drink.
listRoleDefinitions: The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that is given to the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
The <fen>Recipient</fen>'s intended purpose for the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The entity that Speakers refer to by using the Name.
The linguistic expression by which Speakers refer to the Entity.
The person who uses the linguistic expression (Name) to refer to the Referent.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that changes ownership.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
This is the person who completes the movement of the <fen>Theme</fen> after having transported it.
The end of the path and intended goal of the sending.
The objects being delivered.
This is the <fen>Recipient</fen> of the sent <fen>Theme</fen>.
When the delivery takes place
The location at which the delivery takes place.
The <fen>Theme</fen> whose motion is blocked or free.
The place or thing that the <fen>Theme</fen> is headed towards, despite a potential or actual <fen>Barrier</fen>.
An entity, event, or state that (at least potentially) prevents the <fen>Theme</fen> from getting to the <fen>Useful_location</fen>.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and offers it to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen> .
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object which is offered for transfer.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Offerer</fen> offers the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Offerer</fen> offers the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen>.
listRoleExamples: I approve of <fex>your</fex> having supplied him with a file of soldiers.
VESID also supplied <fex>him</fex> with an all zone bus pass to help him travel to interviews.

Cromwell merged men from multiple regiments into a single one and provisioned
them <fex>with red uniforms</fex> to replace their former regiment colors.
God gave them the promise of victory and equipped them <fex>for the battle</fex>.
In Breidbach, water tankers were <fex>yesterday</fex> supplied to the community as the main water supply pipe had been washed away.

The Harpley was launched in Launceston on the 2nd February, 1847, and with the exception
of her chain cables, was <fex>there</fex> supplied with all her materials and stores.
That afternoon, <fex>a staff courier</fex> delivered the box from St. Petersburg to Largo.
I delivered the packages <fex>to the storage room</fex>.
I delivered <fex>the documents</fex> to the court house.
Tess delivered a package <fex>to Abby and her kitty</fex>.
I delivered the letter to you <fex>last week</fex>, Sir.
Barney delivered the letter on Monday <fex>in Sheboygan</fex>
